Company: Mercy Health f/k/a Sisters of Mercy Health System
Description: The Department of Justice reached 70 settlements involving 457 hospitals in 43 states for more than $250 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.

Two Southwest Missouri health care providers agreed to pay the United States $5.5 million to settle allegations that they violated the False Claims Act by engaging in improper financial relationships with referring physicians.  The two providers were Mercy Health Springfield Communities, formerly known as St. John's Health System Inc., which owns and operates a hospital in Springfield, Missouri, and its affiliate, Mercy Clinic Springfield Communities, formerly known as St. John's Clinic, which operates health care facilities in southwest Missouri.

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Mercy Hospital Inc. (d/b/a Mercy Medical Center) of Springfield, Mass., agreed to pay the United States $2,799,462 to settle claims that it violated the False Claims Act between 2005 and 2006 by failing to provide, or failing to document that it provided, the minimum number of hours of rehabilitation therapy required under Medicare guidelines.

Company: Mercy Hospital Springfield f/k/a St. John's Regional Health Center andMercy Clinic Springfield Communities f/k/a St. John's Clinic
Description: Two Southwest Missouri health care providers agreed to pay the United States $34,000,000 to settle allegations that they violated the False Claims Act by engaging in improper financial relationships with referring physicians.

Company: St. John's Mercy Health System d/b/a St. John's Mercy Medical Center
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case

Description: Fourteen hospitals located in New York, Mississippi, North Carolina, Washington, Indiana, Missouri and Florida agreed to pay the United States a total of more than $12 million to settle allegations that the health care facilities submitted false claims to Medicare relating to lyphplasty services.
